author: BBC News
description:
Randy Pitchford, CEO of Gearbox Software, has said he "definitely deserved criticism" after saying "if you're a fan, you'll find a way to afford" the $70 price tag for Borderlands 4.
 
Speaking to BBC Newsbeat, Pitchford explained in depth his thought process behind the comments and that "all criticism is justified."
 
He also explains how "the suits" in the gaming industry expected Borderlands to fail when making the first game, and how the latest technology allowed Borderlands 4 to "live up to the ambition" Gerabox has always had for the franchise.

We also get Pitchford's insights into whether the Borderlands movie helped or hindered the game.
 
CREDIT: Borderlands 4 | GEARBOX SOFTWARE, Borderlands | Lionsgate Films

Subscribe here: http://bit.ly/1rbfUog

For more news, analysis and features visit: www.bbc.com/news 

#Borderlands4 #Gaming #BBCNews
title: Borderlands 4: Gearbox boss Randy Pitchford on cost and criticism | BBC News

author: BBC News
title: Borderlands boss told game would fail during production. #Borderlands #Gaming #BBCNews

author: BBC News
description:
Today, we look back at a very difficult week for Keir Starmer and the Government.

Lord Mandelson’s sacking as UK ambassador to the US comes only days after the Prime Minister reshuffled his cabinet and the resignation of his deputy, Angela Rayner.

Starmer sacked Lord Mandelson after new information emerged about his friendship with convicted paedophile Jeffrey Epstein – a week before US President Trump’s visit to the UK.

Where does this string of trouble leave the party? And, why is there so much focus on one of Keir Starmer’s main advisors?

Adam is joined in the studio by Sienna Rodgers, Deputy Editor at The House Magazine and Patrick Maguire, Chief Political Commentator at the Times.

You can take part in the Newscast census here - http://bit.ly/4mfhIgb

You can now listen to Newscast on a smart speaker. If you want to listen, just say "Ask BBC Sounds to play Newscast”. It works on most smart speakers.

You can join our Newscast online community here: https://tinyurl.com/newscas
title: Is Keir Starmer under threat over Mandelson and Epstein saga? | BBC Newscast

author: BBC News
title: Tyler Robinson is suspected of killing Charlie Kirk. #CharlieKirk #BBCNews

author: BBC News
description:
Charlie Kirk, the right-wing influencer and trusted ally of Donald Trump has been shot dead while speaking with students at a university in Utah.

Kirk was one of the most prominent conservative activists and media personalities in the United States, and a trusted ally of Donald Trump. Many credit his influence - particularly with young people - as a key reason behind Trump’s victory in last year’s election.

The president, visibly angry and upset, delivered a message to the nation last night in which he described Kirk’s killing as a “dark moment for America”.

Justin, Sarah and Marianna assess who Charlie Kirk really was. what made him so successful and how dangerous a moment this could be for America as a whole.

HOSTS:
• Justin Webb, Radio 4 presenter
• Sarah Smith, North America Editor
• Marianna Spring, Social Media Investigations Senior Correspondent

GET IN TOUCH:
• Join our online community: https://discord.gg/qSrxqNcmRB
• Send us a message or voice note via WhatsApp to +44 33
title: Is Charlie Kirk's killing a dangerous moment for America? | BBC Americast

author: BBC News
title: This is a 'watershed moment' for US, says Utah governor. #Utah #BBCNews

author: BBC News
description:
At least 19 Russian drones entered Polish airspace this week, four of which were shot down. 

The moment was described by Prime Minister, Donald Tusk, as the closest Poland has come to open conflict since the second world war. Moscow insists it did not intend to attack any specific targets, but many in Nato are considering this a deliberate challenge to the ability and willingness of the alliance to defend itself.
 
For their reaction to the incursion, Lucy Hockings and Vitaly Shevchenko are joined by BBC Verify’s Olga Robinson and security correspondent Frank Gardner. They consider the prospect of escalation, and explain why the western response might seem cautious.

Listen to the full episode here: https://www.bbc.co.uk/sounds/play/p0m279tg

Subscribe here: http://bit.ly/1rbfUog

For more news, analysis and features visit: www.bbc.com/news 

#BBCNews #Ukraine #Russia
title: Are Russian drones in Poland a warning to Nato? | BBC News

author: BBC News
title: A friend turned Tyler Robinson in, Utah's governor said. #CharlieKirk #BBCNews

author: BBC News
description:
Israel's military operation in Gaza has killed tens of thousands of people, destroyed thousands of buildings, and severely restricted the supply of food.
 
The operation was launched after Hamas rampaged through villages, military posts and a music festival in Israel on 7 October 2023, killing about 1,200 people and taking 251 others hostage. The United Nations' human rights body would later conclude that Hamas had committed war crimes and crimes against humanity.
 
Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said at the time that "like every country, Israel has an inherent right to defend itself". He argues his country's military operation in Gaza is a "just war" with the goals of destroying Hamas and bringing home all the hostages.
 
In January 2024, he said that "Israel's commitment to international law is unwavering". That commitment is coming under ever-increasing scrutiny.
 
More than 64,500 people have been killed by Israel during its campaign - almost half of them women and children, ac
title: Israel's war in Gaza and proportionality | BBC News

author: BBC News
title: Utah's governor said messages were found on bullet casings. #CharlieKirk #BBCNews

author: BBC News
description:
An estimated 218,000 people need evacuation from the Donetsk region, in eastern Ukraine, including 16,500 children.
 
The area, which is crucial to the country's defence, is bearing the brunt of Russia's invasion, including daily attacks from drones and missiles.
 
Some are unable to leave, other unwilling. 
 
And despite the growing threat from Russian drones there are those who would rather take their chances than leave their homes.
 
From the frontline communities in Donetsk, described by the UN as  some of the deadliest for mainly elderly civilians staying behind, our international correspondent Quentin Sommerville sent this report.

Subscribe here: http://bit.ly/1rbfUog

For more news, analysis and features visit: www.bbc.com/news 

#Russia #Ukraine #BBCNews
title: Ukrainians face life or death calculations as Russia inches closer in Donetsk | BBC News

author: BBC News
description:
The suspect in the killing of US activist Charlie Kirk has been named as 22-year-old, Tyler Robinson.
 
“We got him,” Utah Governor Spencer Cox said during a news conference, adding that family and a friend helped bring him to custody.
 
Robinson's father recognised him from FBI images, sources say - after Robinson confessed, the father helped turn him in. 
 
Subscribe here: http://bit.ly/1rbfUog
 
For more news, analysis and features visit: www.bbc.com/news
 
#CharlieKirk #US #BBCNews
title: Tyler Robinson named as Charlie Kirk shooting suspect | BBC News

title: Tyler Robinson named as the suspect in the killing of Charlie Kirk. #CharlieKirk #BBCNews

title: What did Charlie Kirk stand for? #CharlieKirk #BBCNews

author: BBC News
description:
US President Donald Trump says authorities have found the suspect in the Charlie Kirk shooting telling Fox News: "With a high degree of certainty, we have him in custody”.
 
The president says "somebody very close to him turned him in" - he says he expects officials to give an update later today.

Trump's comments came after a new video showing the suspect fleeing the scene was released by the FBI and Utah officials.
 
Subscribe here: http://bit.ly/1rbfUog
 
For more news, analysis and features visit: www.bbc.com/news
 
#CharlieKirk #US #BBCNews
title: Charlie Kirk shooting suspect is in custody, Donald Trump tells Fox News | BBC News

author: BBC News
description:
Rescuers in Pakistan have told the BBC that they are struggling to respond to growing flood emergency in province of Punjab.
 
More than two million people have been evacuated in Punjab province as floods sweep the country's eastern region, authorities have said.
 
Another 150,000 have been evacuated in Sindh province, national disaster management chief Inam Haider Malik told reporters on Thursday, warning that the "number may rise over the coming days".
 
Climate change has worsened floods in Pakistan, as heavy rains cause rivers to overflow. 
 
Subscribe here: http://bit.ly/1rbfUog
 
For more news, analysis and features visit: www.bbc.com/news
 
#Pakistan #PakistanFloods #BBCNews
title: Pakistan floods: Rescuers tell BBC of growing flood emergency | BBC News

author: BBC News
description:
Prince Harry has made a surprise visit to Kyiv, after an invitation by an organisation that supports Ukrainians with life-changing injuries caused by the war.
 
The Duke of Sussex said he wanted to do "everything possible" to help the recovery of injured military personnel.
 
He arrived by train on Friday morning and is understood to have a busy schedule for the day, but no official details can be expected until this evening.
 
Subscribe here: http://bit.ly/1rbfUog
 
For more news, analysis and features visit: www.bbc.com/news

title: Prince Harry makes surprise visit to Ukraine | BBC News

author: BBC News
description:
The manhunt for the Charlie Kirk shooting suspect continues with the FBI offering $100,000 for information.
 
FBI and Utah officials released a new video showing the gunmen fleeing the scene. 
 
In the clip, a person runs across a roof where the fatal shot was fired from and drops several feet to the ground, before running into a wooded area.
 
Authorities said they are gathering all the evidence needed to "pursue the death penalty" for the suspect. 
 
Subscribe here: http://bit.ly/1rbfUog
 
For more news, analysis and features visit: www.bbc.com/news
 
#CharlieKirk #US #BBCNews
title: Charlie Kirk shooting suspect manhunt continues as FBI releases new video | BBC News

author: BBC News
description:
The FBI and Utah officials have released a new video showing the suspect fleeing the scene of the crime - running across the roof and dropping over the edge before entering a wooded area.

A black T-shirt with an American flag and Converse shoes were highlighted as "distinctive" features of the suspect who killed Charlie Kirk, a key ally of President Trump.

DNA examinations of the crime scene are being conducted for prosecutors to pursue death penalty for the suspect, police say.

Subscribe here: http://bit.ly/1rbfUog

For more news, analysis and features visit: www.bbc.com/news 

#US #BBCNews
title: Police release video showing Charlie Kirk shooting suspect fleeing scene | BBC News
